Disable Unicast Routing.

questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI fabric must detect all silent endpoints for the Layer 3 bridge domain. Which actions accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In Cisco ACI, silent endpoints are devices that do not send traffic until they receive it (e.g., IoT devices, printers, or certain servers). Detecting silent endpoints in a Layer 3 Bridge Domain (BD) requires specific configurations to ensure that these endpoints are discovered and learned by the fabric.

Selected Answer: A
To detect all silent endpoints for the Layer 3 bridge domain in a Cisco ACI fabric, Option A is the correct answer:

Explanation:

 1. Enable Unicast Routing:
 • Enabling unicast routing ensures that the bridge domain is treated as a Layer 3 domain, allowing endpoint discovery using ARP requests and routing functionalities.
 2. Disable ARP Flooding:
 • Disabling ARP flooding ensures that ARP requests are not broadcasted indiscriminately across the fabric. Instead, Cisco ACI leverages ARP Gleaning and hardware proxy to manage ARP requests efficiently, which is required for silent endpoint detection.

comments.content:
Disabling ARP flooding will not detect silent IP that moved from one location to another without notifying an ACI leaf.
Ans is C

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Should be A

questions.question_text: Which two hardware models are supported as fixed spine in Cisco ACI fabrics? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
In Cisco ACI fabrics, fixed spine switches are compact, non-modular switches that serve as spines in a leaf-and-spine topology. The Cisco Nexus 9300 Series switches include models that can operate as fixed spines. Based on the provided information and Cisco documentation, the following models are supported as fixed spine switches:
Cisco Nexus 9332C:
A 1-Rack-Unit (1RU) fixed spine switch.
Supports 32 fixed 40/100G QSFP28 ports.
Provides 6.4 Tbps of bandwidth and supports wire-rate MACsec encryption on select ports35.
Cisco Nexus 9364C:
A 2-Rack-Unit (2RU) fixed spine switch.
Supports 64 fixed 40/100G QSFP28 ports.
Provides 12.84 Tbps of bandwidth and supports wire-rate MACsec encryption on select ports35.
These switches are designed for small to medium-sized ACI fabrics and provide high-performance connectivity with advanced features like MACsec encryption.

Selected Answer: B
associate security domain “Tenant” under PROD tenant, common security domain is default associated to every user

Selected Answer: D
In Cisco ACI (Application Centric Infrastructure), security domains are used to define access permissions for users. The purpose is to associate users with specific parts of the ACI fabric, such as tenants, VRFs, or application profiles.

Selected Answer: D
In Cisco ACI (Application Centric Infrastructure), security domains are used to define access permissions for users. The purpose is to associate users with specific parts of the ACI fabric, such as tenants, VRFs, or application profiles.

Selected Answer: D
Explanation:

 1. Security Domain in Cisco ACI:
 • A security domain restricts access to specific parts of the fabric (tenants, application profiles, etc.) for a user or group.
 • In this case, the user should only access the common tenant and the PROD tenant.
 2. Action Breakdown:
 • By adding the “common” security domain to the user, you limit their access to only common-associated resources.
 • Associating the “common” domain with the PROD tenant ensures access to the relevant parts of the PROD tenant without unnecessarily broadening access (e.g., using “all” security domains).

choices.D:
Add security domain “common” to User.
Associate security domain “common” under PROD tenant.
choices.B:
Add security domain “Tenant” to User.
Associate security domain “Tenant” under PROD tenant.
choices.A:
Add security domain “mgmt.” to User.
Associate security domain “mgmt.” under PROD tenant.
choices.C:
Add security domain “all” to User.
Associate security domain “all” under PROD tenant

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In Cisco ACI, Intra-EPG Isolation is a feature that prevents communication between endpoints within the same EPG. By default, endpoints in the same EPG can communicate freely without requiring contracts. To disable communication between two backup servers within the same EPG (e.g., in the "Backup EPG"), you need to enforce Intra-EPG Isolation.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must disable the communication between the two backup servers in the backup EPG. Which action accomplishes this goal?

choices.B: Set the physical domain to None.
choices.A: Set Preferred Group Member to Excluded.
choices.C: Set a different static binding for the encap VLAN.
choices.D: Set Intra EPG Isolation to Enforced.

questions.question_text: A Cisco ACI fabric contains 10 standalone leaf switches. An engineer must configure only the first two leaf switches in a VPC. Which VPC protection type must be configured to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It is not D because Consecutive" would pair switches in order (1,2), (3,4), (5,6), etc. While it includes the desired pair (1,2), it also creates other pairs that the engineer doesn't want. The requirement is only the first two.
In Cisco ACI, when configuring a vPC (Virtual Port Channel) between two specific leaf switches, you must use an Explicit Protection Group. This configuration explicitly defines which leaf switches will form the vPC pair.

Selected Answer: B
should be explict
